name: andyk
text:
even though i've already read this, this gives me much anticipation.

also, 5 for the dead kennedys shirt on beef.

name: kilroywashere
text: Oh hey, Stubbs took the northeast corner. Didn't notice that before.

name: senseihollywood
text: nice catch

name: senseihollywood
text: what about them side dishes?

name: catachresis
text: He can't stop with his thinking about the side dishes [link to previous strip at the start of the GOF that I am so not chasing up right now]

name: riazm
text: I do what I gotta do.

name: ttagxamm
text: Also, check out panel 5.  Ray is 12 kinds of bummed out at the notion of not getting any dinner.

name: mirzabah
text: I find it amusing that upon hearing the second option Ray's mouth transforms into 3/4 of a swastika.

name: troy_convers
text: Sailing close to the ''Godwin's Law' rule, dude...

name: soticoto
text: "Have you seen the Yellow Sign?"

name: wehavemagnums
text: I love reading the names of the (I assume) previous winners along Beef's tape rack. Onstad must have had so much fun with this arc.

name: closefriend
text: I can't listen to RLS in this strip without thinking of Apollo Creed for some reason.

name: contrasoma
text: I've always thought RLS' rhyming was an Ali reference.

name: epicurus
text: A five, pretty much entirely for Roast Beef's childhood.

name: abreez_e
text:
What dramatic irony in the childhood, too. The young Beef doesn't realise he is listening to a recording of the proposal that led to the marriage which would produce his best friend.

And THAT friendship led to his use of knowledge from those tapes to help his best friend emulate his father, who had been one of the gods who populated young Beef's childhood. How circular.

name: dallovich
text: I believe that Ray was already born when Beef is hearing this, he just doesn't know that it's Sondra (who he has most likely met) and RLS (who he most likely has not met).

name: riotdejaneiro
text: You're right, but the guy above you didn't say anything about Ray being born after Roast Beef listened to these recordings. I am just saying this, without being a cock to a stranger.

name: sharktastic
text: I love this. All over the internet, message boards and online communities are filled with some of the worst hatred and filth imaginable. Yet here at Achewood we have a pretty decent community, and we police ourselves by adopting a sensible rule that came out of the mouth of a fictitious cat who was slightly stoned. Chubby for you for not being a cock to a stranger.

name: tellumo
text: Beef uses the Tandy tape player and TDK cassettes. Sony and Maxell are for yuppies like Ray.

name: wehavemagnums
text: That's a good insight!

name: stormagnet
text: I bet he learned how to mod it to make tape backups off the library computers.

name: tellumo
text: Totally. All with his garage-sale soldering iron and 49-cent Radio Shack parts, all burnin' his fingers . . .

name: magnetocat
text: all sick on solder fumes in a closed bedroom.

name: estutius
text: Bob Raffles: The Micheal Cole of the Great Outdoor Fight

name: gumfish
text: I like the transition between the hot dog cheeser and the snack tent panel.

name: stuart
text: Is there anything more appropriate than seeing those speakers and thinking of Battle Royale

name: phthoggos
text: an animal all the while, no receipt on file, no loyalty no style.

name: serf
text: i could go for a hotdog cheeser

name: ttagxamm
text: What is a hotdog cheeser? Something like this , maybe?

name: greenkoolayd
text: i thought it was a one of those hot dogs with cheese in the middle.

name: lucid
text:
Oh my god this entire time I've been reading it as hotdog chaser and assuming it was just a hotdog with no bun and involved his mother being an angry drunk.

I could never picture any more detail than that, but simply let it slide, like I don't have to fully understand a throwaway reference to get the general idea.

name: vondicus
text: Oscar Mayer hot dog with Kraft singles melted over the top. Microwaved, of course.

name: awksedperl
text: Is "Motor City Massacre" a person or something that made the 1969 GOF even more special?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i submit it is the winner of the fight that year.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: also the precursor to Motion City Soundtrack.

name: awksedperl
text: cpnglxynchos, spacing out his follow-up posts.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: since a week ago.

name: aezlo
text: Indeed.

name: brzbee
text: This whole story line is just so epic and beautiful...

name: dasilodavi
text: Panel 7.  I'd love to see the no doubt deeply pensive look in Beef's eyes when he sees this wisp of Leonard Stubbs in Ray.

name: twohundredninety
text: The sentence is the basic unit of information.

name: sevendaughters
text: Dude is in a LINEAGE.

name: the_voice
text: Where are the fucking SIDE DISHES?

name: speth
text: RUFUS

name: tombsgrave
text: You know, I like Bob Raffles's exuberant commentary.  I'm kind of cheesy like that, though... kind of hot dog cheeser-y.

name: quinlaenar
text: Snack tent is about the best name for something like this ever.

name: echidnaboy
text: Dammit why can't I ever be called urgently to the snack tent
